This is a demo Pascal syntax-highlighting test, therefore contains nonsensical (but syntactically valid) Pascal designed to test ace and nonsensical other languages



program Demo;
uses crt;
const
    Size = 10;
type
    CharArrType = array[1..Size] of Char;
var
    alpha, beta, arr: CharArrType;

begin
   writeln('Demo2');
   readkey;
end. 

/** Info
*/
public abstract class Demo {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println("wrong");
    
    Integer.toString(42);
}

def other():
    """something"""
    return None;
    
function trial()

    let or = 'one';
    for (const a of "js") {
        var hi = 0;
    }
    return;


#include 
int main(void) {
    putchar('x');
    bool true; 
}
